reviews.text: Beautiful little station. It really very pretty. It only has northern rail services between Manchester Oxford Road and Liverpool Lime Street. The rest of the trains pass by. It has an over-head footbridge and waiting shelters and seats. It is quite a small station but very pretty.
Easily the best station on the Manchester - Liverpool line as it doubles up as a Chippy.

No ticket services at this station or on the train - they then had the cheek to put three subcontractors on the gate asking departing travellers to check their tickets. There was no ticket man on the train during this journey from Manchester - but they proceeded to aggressively target the youngest passengers for their details, even after it had been explained to them by adult passengers that many hadn't been given the opportunity to buy tickets. Its a disgrace that they will try to enforce this when the facilites arent even adequate. Money could be better spent elsewhere, for example by putting conductors on the train to check and sell tickets.
I'd be lying if I said it was a good as King's Cross.
